content:
ファイルが見つかりませんでした。ファイルの場所を確認して再度試してください。

メッセージのコピーはこちら mid:20250720193325552457@saisoncard.co.jp

上記のメッセージが表示されますが、削除できません。 ローカルmailbox内に保存もされていません。 Trashも作り直しましたが無理でした。 差出人は最新のメールアドレスになっていてバグっています。

消す方法を教えてほしいです。

title: Will duplicates appear after conversion?
creator: clarawinslow133
content: Most​‍​‌‍​‍‌​‍​‌‍​‍‌ of the duplicate records are from the original VCF files, the duplication sources are not from the conversion process. I performed the same conversion on multiple backup files with the help of GainTools vCard to CSV Converter and found that duplicates remained in the source. The way it works is to allow you to Convert VCF to CSV in a neat manner, keeping all data intact, while the free demo is there to let you have a quick look at the CSV before the final export. The product features of vCard 2.1, 3.0, and 4.0 support are there to make sure that no fields are lost. After the file conversion, duplicates can be removed easily with the help of Excel or Outlook tools. Good preparation will keep your contact list from becoming a mess and will guarantee that your imports are done ​‍​‌‍​‍‌​‍​‌‍​‍‌correctly.

title: All Messages shows date in April
creator: leonardo17
content:
Dear Community,

I have installed Thunderbird on a new system and imported my mailbox and archives from my old Mac (both running macOS). I am currently using macOS Monterey 12.7.6 and Thunderbird 40.5.0 ESR (64-bit).

All messages—whether imported or newly received—both in the Inbox and in archives are showing the month as April (i.e., xx/4/xx). This issue also appears in the email body when replying or forwarding messages. Please note that the day and year are correct, only the month appears incorrectly as “4” (April)on all messages.

Messages in the imported local folder archives display the correct dates. I have email folders going back to 2006, and I would greatly appreciate your guidance to resolve this issue.

Many thanks in advance, Leonardo

title: Via welke poort moet ik mail verzenden via gmail
creator: e.boerwinkel
content: Ik ben een paar weken geleden overgestapt van W10 naar W11, omdat het ondanks veel pogingen niet lukte om mail te zenden via Gmail - nadat het jaren goed was gegaan. Mail binnenhalen lukte in oktober 2025 wel en nu na opnieuw mail instellen ook. Ik heb na de overstap alle profielen van Thunderbird verwijderd en opnieuw automatisch een profiel aangemaakt met als gevolg imap.gmail.com voor inkomende en smtp.gmail.com voor uitgaande mail. Ik log in op mijn gmail account met hetzelfde ww als op accounts.google en authenticatie op 2auth0. Binnenhalen van mail gaat goed, maar zenden gaat nog steeds niet. Mijn poort 587 staat door de automatische configuratie ingesteld voor zenden, maar dat stond eerder ingesteld op poort 465. Moet ik dat weer op 465 zetten ? Ik hoor graag.

content:

Is there somewhere some log to see why the synching stops?

title: Thunderbird cannot connect to Comcast IMAP server
creator: danf2223
content: I've used Thunderbird for years. Just came back from vacation and I can no longer receive email from Comcast. I get a message stating timeout connecting to the IMAP server. I have tried removing my account and installing it again using the automatic installation. Still cannot connect to the server. Interestingly I send send an email which goes through even though I get an IMAP connection error. I have tried removing and reinstalling my account. I have gone onto Comcast and made sure that third party mail programs can have access. I do not have a VPN. I am using standard Windows Defender security. Never had a problem before this but I went in and put in an exclusion for Thunderbird anyway. Very frustrated, any help would be appreciated.

title: can't delete "special account" named "server7.invalid" created by import
creator: bhaller
content: I'm just getting set up with Thunderbird. I used to use Postbox, and imported my Postbox profile into Thunderbird, which overall worked great – it got all my local email folders, and brought in my Apple email account, and so forth. The only wrinkle I've noticed so far is that it also created an account named "server7.invalid" that I can't delete. If I go to Account Settings, for "server7.invalid" it states "The following is a special account. There are no identities associated with it." The only items underneath it are "Spam Settings" and "Disk Space". There is no red Delete button for it, the way there is for my two real (IMAP) email accounts. Viewed on the Mail tab, it appears to contain only "Trash" and "Outbox", and both of those are empty. This weird invalid account doesn't seem to be doing any harm, but of course it is ugly and I just want it to go away. Help?
